question_text: What distinguishes a hosted hypervisor from a bare metal hypervisor?
answer_options: It requires no operating system at all
It runs directly on the physical hardware
It runs on top of a traditional operating system
It manages only cloud-based virtual machines
correct_answer: It runs on top of a traditional operating system
explanation: A hosted hypervisor (Type 2) relies on a host OS to operate, unlike bare metal (Type 1) hypervisors.
